intro: Gavilea acutiflora, commonly known as the sharp-flowered gavilea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy, cone-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, are adapted for insect pollination. Gavilea acutiflora is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
